assertions.text: Delete message option should be there only once and other should be no two ways to delete a message.

evidence.description: First delete path: Long-press on message bubble reveals full context menu with Delete option alongside Reply, Forward, Copy, Edit, Info, Star, and More
User taps message entering selection mode with checkboxes, showing alternative interaction model
Second delete path: While in selection mode, long-press reveals condensed context menu with Pin, Translate, Delete, and More options
Both paths converge to the same 'Delete message?' confirmation dialog with 'Delete for everyone' and 'Delete for me' options

assertions.explanation: The user was able to access the delete functionality through multiple distinct interaction paths. First, a long-press revealed a context menu with a 'Delete' option among other actions (Reply, Forward, Copy, etc.). Then, after tapping the message to enter selection mode, another long-press revealed a different, condensed context menu that also included a 'Delete' option. Both paths led to the same delete confirmation dialog, demonstrating two separate ways to delete a message rather than a single, consistent method.
